seg.seg: "I will be an omniscient [Buddha]", thus he roared the great lion roar ...
«I will be an omniscient [Buddha]», thus he roared the great lion roar …
"If I try to redeem myself from such sorrows, I will put them aside who made me ...

«If I try to redeem myself from such sorrows, I will put them aside who made me … with the beings of the five births.» Thereupon he took the firm resolution with his mind: «[In] all [my] lives, (with) all [my] bodies, (I will strive) for the welfare of the beings (of the five births).» (cf 720; 1957: 227; 1997: 141; 342)
with the beings of the five births." Thereupon he took the firm resolution with his mind: "[In] all [my] lives, (with) all [my] bodies,
Darauf fasste er den festen Entschluss in seinem Denken.
Thereupon he made the firm decision in his thought.
(I will strive) for the welfare of the beings (of the five births). Even if all beings crush my bones fine like to dust, or if they chop up my body ...,

Even if all beings crush my bones fine like to dust, or if they chop up my body …, or if I had to undergo sorrows of hell, or if because of the smallest thing I underwent sorrow[s] of hell, may the power of my mind not fail … (cf 725; 1997: 118; 466)
or if I had to undergo sorrows of hell, or if because of the smallest thing I underwent sorrow[s] of hell, may the power of my mind not fail ...
